result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Tyrone Rucker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable court costs and fees, including DNA surcharges by 05-19-16, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence; Huber privileges, pursuant to 303.08 Wis. Stats. for school and treatment. Sentence stayed to 06-08-15 at 5pm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric Tyrone Rucker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Denying Petitions for Expungement, signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Conen, Br. 30, for review. mag
Filed by Eric Rucker, Letter Requesting Expungment and Supplemental Documentation  (Return Address:  Eric Rucker, 3058 N. 34th Street, Milwaukee, WI  53210).

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served. The Court granted Huber privileges, pursuant to 303.08 Wis. Stats. for school and treatment.

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and fees, including DNA surcharges by 5/19/16, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Sentence stayed to 6/8/15 at 5pm.

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Eric Tyrone Rucker in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 
AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to cases 13CM3467 & 15CM480 
for the purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Eric Tyrone Rucker in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty  plea and sentencing. Court ordered stayed warrant cancelled.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Leah R. Thomas in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next scheduled hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric Tyrone Rucker in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status conference. Parties need additional time to negotiate global resolution.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MAYFAIR MALL.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Eric Tyrone Rucker in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Eric Tyrone Rucker in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
